d air dried. The amounts of TC and TG were measured using the kit according to the manufacturer's instructions. An internal standard control was used to correct the error.

Bone densitometry using micro-CT: femur was fixed in 1X DPBS containing 3% formaldehyde for two weeks. After one week the fixation solution was changed. The femur density was measured by Siemens Inveon Micro-CT. HU2000 values were analyzed using Inveon Research Workplace (IRW) under the following measurement conditions: 80KVP,500mA,1500ms exposure time; CCD reader installation: 2048 axes, 2048 bins; trans-axis FOV:19.03mm, shaft: 19.03mm, pixel size: 9.29 μm.

Cell lysate extraction, western blot, total RNA extraction and RT-qPCR: cells were harvested and lysed in RIPA buffer or 1X DPBS containing 1% triton-X100 and protease inhibitor cocktail. Total protein concentration was measured using Bio-rad protein staining dye. Western blotting was performed using nitrocellulose membranes (Millipore) and a Bio-rad semi-dry transfer system, following standard protocols. Total RNA was extracted using RNA extraction solution (sigma). RT-qPCR was performed using Roche Sybr qPCR kit and ABI7900HT PCR apparatus using the following procedure: 95℃for 10min, then 40 cycles of 95℃for 10sec and 60℃for 1min.

Statistical analysis: in the tables and graphs, the results are expressed as average +STDEV. Asterisks indicate statistically significant differences calculated using the two-tailed student's t test.

Example 2 binding assay of mandipropamid and dinordrin

Dinordrin has similar results to the mandipropionate except that it has a-H at the R6 position. We found that 50nM dinordrin blocked 0.5nM[H 3 -E2]63.2.+ -. 5.7% of the binding to 1. Mu.g of GST-ER- α -LBD on the beads. In contrast, the mandipropargyl carbon loss esters do not cause blocking [ H 3 -E2]Inhibition of binding to 1. Mu.g of GST-ER-alpha-LBD.

In addition, 6. Mu.M dinordrin increased transcription of Bcl-2mRNA by 147.2% + -22.73% (P < 0.001). In contrast, a statistically insignificant difference of 3.18% + -3.22% caused by mandipropamidic carbon loss was measured in MCF-7 cells using RT-qPCR.

The results show that R6-CH3 (as opposed to-H) is essential for the unique functional characteristics of the mandipropargyl carbon loss ester.
